Description:
We are looking for a Principal Transport Planner to be based in our Riyadh office -We have an immediate requirement for a Principal Transport Planner in KSA who will lead Transport Planning & Mobility projects from tender to close-out, and lead a team of transport planners, traffic engineers and transport modelers. The role also requires working closely with the Master Planning, Urban Design and Highways teams.The role will report to the Transport Planning & Advisory Lead and work closely with the Transport Planning team in our Global Design Centre (GDC), drawing upon this talent pool to deliver projects and work packages as appropriateResponsibilitiesThe successful candidate would be expected to lead and support a range of transport planning studies both on their own and for other staff working within a team, reporting to a team leader and project managers. You will also be expected to manage and perform the following duties:Prepare designs, calculations, drawings, programmes for specific jobs

Check drawings, calculations or output from analytical programs

Development Program Lead responsible for the development of graduates and junior staff members

Provide information for reports and participate in particular investigations as required

Evaluate transport planning issues and problems, consulting with team leader as necessary

Execute transport analysis using appropriate design aids (for example transport assignment software, appraisal tools, Microsoft Office packages) with particular attention to accuracy and reliability to data input and analysis

Manage a team of Transport Planners and Traffic Modellers

Ensure tasks are carried out within agreed timescales and budgets

Assist the Project Managers in tracking the delivery progress and financials on projects.

Liaise with other disciplines and clients as required on technical aspects

Keep up-to-date with current methods and the latest research in transport planningRequirements12+ years post-graduate experience in transport planning

Degree in transport related subject, numeric subject or equivalent professional qualification

Technical background in transport planning & policy, transport modelling & appraisal, demand modelling & analysis would be of benefit

Proven track record in the delivery of traffic planning analysis/studies to a high standard

Experience of major Master Planning projects as well as a Traffic Impact Studies

Excellent report writing and presentational skills

Proficient IT skills (Microsoft Office) and working knowledge of industry standard tools and modelling software such as VISUM, VISSIM, SIDRA, SYNCHRO, HCM

Arabic speaker desirable but not essential

Experience in EMME software is desirable but not essential

Previous experience in the region, especially on any Saudi mega projects, is highly desirableThe Individual (Key Behaviours):Confident and articulate communicator with experience of building strong working relationships.

A high expectation of performance and continuous improvement for themselves and team.

Ability to position Atkins as a leading partner and supplier.

Customer focused with excellent interpersonal, organisational and communication skills.

Mentoring less experienced members of the team.

Confident and professional manner and communication style, and the ability to communicate effectively with colleagues, clients and stakeholders

Excellent interpersonal, organisational and communication skills both verbally and in writing

Ability to build and motivate a team and demonstrate good leadership qualities.

Be available to travel across the Middle East & Africa Region and work away from home, including periods overseas on assignments

Strong collaborative behaviours to interface with clients, other members of the Transportation team, internal Atkins teams, GDC and other suppliers.

Excellent team player, able to influence technical and delivery staff, and collaborate effectively with other divisional colleagues and with the Senior Leadership TeamRewards & BenefitsWe offer an excellent package which includes:

A competitive salary

Transportation allowance

Medical and life insurance cover

22 calendar days annual leave

Company gratuity scheme

Discretionary bonus scheme
